He wanted to get the hell out of there, and he'd heard the rumors. Heaven was on the other side, north of the bridge. All he had to do was get there, across that godforsaken Golden Gate.

He was far from it, where he was in the Lower Haight, heading east. He'd spent the night at Alamo Square Park, because it was safer there than the shelters. Plus, he liked waking up to the Painted Ladies. The yellow one, in particular, because it reminded him of his mother. She was sunshine personified.
